dict.string: Upload files and folders for easy sharing

# Helpers function notification { ./notificator --message "${1}" --title "${alfred_workflow_name}" }
# Save input file information for display name_array=()
for filepath in "${@}" do name_array+=("$(basename "${filepath}")") done
readonly name_list="${(j:, :)name_array}" unset name_array
# Files to write progress information readonly progress_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/progress.txt" readonly name_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/name.txt"
# Ensure cache folder and cleanup on exit mkdir -p "${alfred_workflow_cache}" trap 'rm "${progress_file}" "${name_file}"' EXIT
# Show notification to start and write initial information notification "${name_list}" printf '%s' "${name_list}" > "${name_file}"
# Upload, saving the result for display and redirecting progress # Show output message and sound accordingly if ./upload-file \ --upload-host "${upload_file_to}" \ --dummy-text 'uploadfile_process_anchor' \ "${@}" 2> "${progress_file}" then afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Ping.aiff notification 'Copied URL to clipboard' else afplay /System/Library/Sounds/Funk.aiff notification 'Upload Failed' exit fi
Shows progress of the current UploadFile upload

## Usage
Upload files and folders via the [Universal Action](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/universal-actions/). Folders and multiple files are zipped prior to upload.
![Upload file](images/about/ua.png)
When done, the download link is copied to the clipboard. Check upload progress via the `ufp` keyword.
![Upload progress](images/about/ufp.png)
* <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Cancel upload.
